t: Matthew 1
The Genealogy of Jesus the Messiah
This*p is the genealogy of Jesus the Messiah the son of David, the son of Abraham:
Abraham*pln was the father of Isaac, Isaac*ld the father of Jacob, Jacob*ld the father of Judah and his brothers,
Judah*ld the father of Perez and Zerah, whose mother was Tamar, Perez*ld the father of Hezron, Hezron*ld the father of Ram,
Ram*ld the father of Amminadab, Amminadab*ld the father of Nahshon, Nahshon*ld the father of Salmon,
Salmon*ld the father of Boaz, whose mother was Rahab, Boaz*ld the father of Obed, whose mother was Ruth, Obed*ld the father of Jesse,
and*ld Jesse the father of King David. David*pln was the father of Solomon, whose mother had been Uriah’s wife,
Solomon*ld the father of Rehoboam, Rehoboam*ld the father of Abijah, Abijah*ld the father of Asa,
Asa*ld the father of Jehoshaphat, Jehoshaphat*ld the father of Jehoram, Jehoram*ld the father of Uzziah,
Uzziah*ld the father of Jotham, Jotham*ld the father of Ahaz, Ahaz*ld the father of Hezekiah,
Hezekiah*ld the father of Manasseh, Manasseh*ld the father of Amon, Amon*ld the father of Josiah,
and*ld Josiah the father of Jeconiah and his brothers at the time of the exile to Babylon.
After*pln the exile to Babylon: Jeconiah*ld was the father of Shealtiel, Shealtiel*ld the father of Zerubbabel,
Zerubbabel*ld the father of Abihud, Abihud*ld the father of Eliakim, Eliakim*ld the father of Azor,
Azor*ld the father of Zadok, Zadok*ld the father of Akim, Akim*ld the father of Elihud,
Elihud*ld the father of Eleazar, Eleazar*ld the father of Matthan, Matthan*ld the father of Jacob,
and*ld Jacob the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, and Mary was the mother of Jesus who is called the Messiah.
Thus*p there were fourteen generations in all from Abraham to David, fourteen from David to the exile to Babylon, and fourteen from the exile to the Messiah.
Joseph Accepts Jesus as His Son
This*p is how the birth of Jesus the Messiah came about: His mother Mary was pledged to be married to Joseph, but before they came together, she was found to be pregnant through the Holy Spirit.
Because Joseph her husband was faithful to the law, and yet did not want to expose her to public disgrace, he had in mind to divorce her quietly.

But*p after he had considered this, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said, “Joseph son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary home as your wife, because what is conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.
She will give birth to a son, and you are to give him the name Jesus, because he will save his people from their sins.”
All*p this took place to fulfill what the Lord had said through the prophet:
“The virgin will conceive and give birth to a son, and they will call him Immanuel” (which means “God with us”).
When*p Joseph woke up, he did what the angel of the Lord had commanded him and took Mary home as his wife.
But he did not consummate their marriage until she gave birth to a son. And he gave him the name Jesus.
